TopicTitle: Where Can I Find The Version Numbers Of My Installed Mods?

Articles.Content:
The subject line pretty much sums it up; but, more info:

I have all of 3 mods, EVE, KAC, KJR. I also have an intermittent bug which I suspect may be KJR-related, but I can't prove it (see the word "intermittent" earlier in the sentence).

Step 1 in "How To Get Support For Your Modded Install" is to make sure all installed mods are up to date, and include mod version numbers in the support request.

So...where the heck do I find the version numbers? KAC has a ReadMe file which includes the version number, but neither EVE nor KJR appear to have any human-readable files nor any version info in file names....
I find, typically the archive the file came in (.zip file) will have the version number in it's name.
Hooo-boy. Let's see if by some freakish mischance I still have those in my Downloads folder....
In some cases you will have to open a .dll or .cfg in a text editor. Some authors put a version number near the top or bottom of those documents, but it's hardly consistent.
